name: Reaction Simulation
description:
REACTION SIMULATION - for Windows
This program is meant to demonstrate the general relationship between concentration, temperature, and pressure for a reaction of gases.  The example used is the reaction of hydrogen and oxygen to form water. There are three levels which allow the user to vary the concentration of reactants and products, temperature, and the pressure. The rate of reaction is indicated by the sound of the various particles colliding. There are four study screens which explain the various reaction mechanisms that could take place. This program is not a strict mathematical model and cannot be used to calculi Keq’a or actual reaction rates. It is meant to give the user a simple visualization of the relationships of the variables.

Download the zip file and extract. Run the setup program. This program works on most Linux distros with PlayonLinux or Wine.

This game has no advertising and neither collects or transmits any data whatsoever. It is free to all and may be installed on as many computers as desired and may be distributed freely. Visit https://sites.google.com/view/rtcgames/home for over 30 freeware programs and Android apps made by the author.
